website_summaries.verdict: If you want a straight-forward pillow that is comfortable and easy to reconfigure, we recommend this one.
pros: Has a patented seat wrap and pocket for tucking it away when not in use
Has a spacious surface and is easy to adjust
cons: The cover isn't removable or waterproof, and the pillow itself is difficult to wash

customer_reviews.title: Many uses- even for mom!
customer_reviews.text: My baby was able to use this from about 3 months until she started crawling at 10 months. We used it for tummy time, as a nursing pillow, and for baby to sit and play in. There is enough space in the front for baby to play with a toy and it keeps her secure. It has been washed many times in the washing machine in 7 months and is in great condition. I do wish the straps could be tightened more. BONUS- after baby outgrows it, it makes a fantastic travel pillow. It's perfect for mom to use as a passenger in the car on long trips.
customer_reviews.author: Healthy FitMom

customer_reviews.title: Good but no removable cover
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 2.5 months old and 12lbs. She loves it. It's great for feeding and acid reflux. On a traditional lounger she would kick and slide down it, this keeps her in place. The Velcro is strong, she kicks hard too! My only gripe is there's no removable cover- my own fault for not seeing that. I just assumed most baby loungers would come with a removable cover. I have washed it in the washing machine and it was fine, I air dried it. It is somewhat resistant to spills. I think this is versatile for different ages.
customer_reviews.author: LeeTop Contributor: Activewear

customer_reviews.title: Wish we had found it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our 2 month old daughter and absolutely love it! We were looking for a "chair" we could strap her into that we could put on the couch with us AMA really didn't find many options. Finally came across this and it's perfect, we only wish we had bought it earlier! The velcro straps are secure enough that we feel comfortable leaving her in it. Obviously, we don't leave her unattended while on the couch but using this is the center of the bed while I fold clothes is a huge help! I would definitely recommend this to all moms!
customer_reviews.author: April M.

customer_reviews.title: Line the back with cotton
customer_reviews.text: Cover material is polyester. After a while baby's back gets really warm then sweaty. I place a cotton towel on it before laying the baby down. Otherwise I like it. It props the baby up just enough, half way between sitting and laying down.
customer_reviews.author: iSpendMoney33713

customer_reviews.title: We put a receiving blanket over the whole thing and it had the perfect angle to prevent spit-up
customer_reviews.text: I know it says not to let the baby sleep in this, but this was the only thing my baby would sleep in for the first 3 months so we used it as a co-sleeper on the bed next to my head. We put a receiving blanket over the whole thing and it had the perfect angle to prevent spit-up.
customer_reviews.author: Phipi

customer_reviews.title: I love this nursing pillow
customer_reviews.text: I love this nursing pillow! As the previous reviews states, this pillow is really better for small/average sized women. I am probably between 150-170 ibs since I returned home from the hospital and started using the pillow, and it fits me pretty well right now. I do not recommend for overweight women. I bought a water proof boppy cover for this pillow and it fits PERFECTLY. I love this pillow and I'm so glad I purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Malissa

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pillow! We got it because our little one wasn't sleeping well and this had a sling to make sure she wouldn't slip down. So far it is working great! She is sleeping better (but doesn't always use the pillow). The pillow is very comfortable and I am happy to know I can use it for feeding and when she is learning to sit. The only problem I have with it so far is it doesn't have a cover so cleaning it would be hard. I haven't needed to clean it yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Monkey A

customer_reviews.title: Iffy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it because it's painful to hold up my baby to feed him, especially with a C section. My son is 3 weeks old and it is hard to fit him on this, he's actually a very tall baby so height isn't the issue. I just feel scared that he isn't getting enough back support being propped up like that since he likes to curl himself and wriggle. What seems to be great is that the moment I put him on there he went right to sleep, it's odd actually since he gives us a hard time to fall asleep. I will update my review if I notice any changes in the coming weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Sakura x JuriTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: This cover isn't removable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use for breastfeeding my second child. My first still uses hers as a pillow regularly and I wanted one with a different cover to differentiate. The pillow I already had has a removable cover, and I thought this one would be as well. I'm concerned that this may make cleaning difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Rose

customer_reviews.title: In love with this pillow
customer_reviews.text: Had a boppy with my oldest and it was the most useless item ever. After reading a billion reviews and hoping for the best I bought this Leachco cuddle-u pillow and I'm SOOO glad I did. My baby is 4 weeks old now and I use it all the time. It's stuffed well and sturdy, but still flexible enough to move around when adjusting. It fits around me no problem (I'm 5'1" and probably was around 170 when I started using it postpartum). The little cloth seat is awesome and my son loves sitting in it and during tummy time. The cover is adorable and WASHABLE. Love everything about this pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Tigureyz72

customer_reviews.title: Cotton coming out of the pillow every time my baby spent on it. She is only 3 months she can't even scratch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it new, but the moment we started using it, it is losing cotton/fur or whatever the name it is called. My baby's hand is full of that cotton. It is horrible!! She could have choked on it. If this is what the product is meant to be I will not encourage anyone to buy it. I bought it because it is considered one of the best product to comfort and train my baby. When it was delivered to me, it looked like a second hand used item. Purposely paid tax and transportation​ fee which amounts to even higher than the product itself yet getting an inferior product.
customer_reviews.author: Wong Tian Yeong

customer_reviews.title: comfortable for baby!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pillow like this I have purchased. The first one is 4 years old and still in great condition, I just needed a second one for my new baby's babysitters house. These pillows are cheaper than others but are just as useful. The pillow is soft but still provides excellent support. The stuffing has stayed fluffed in my old one, so I'm assuming this one will too Edited to add: the pillow split open on the seam. I had to return it. Maybe it was just this one and not all of them. Also, there is not a removable cover on this pillow. That's a disappointing difference from the first one.
customer_reviews.author: dalton

customer_reviews.title: Love it until I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I've had two of these and two Boppy brand pillows. These are about half the price, are firmer, thicker and sturdier. I like that baby is boosted up a little bit higher and that the pillow doesn't go flat over the course of a year of breast feeding! ****Update: baby arrived three weeks ago and I was happy with my pillow until the first big spit up. That's when I realized this pillow had no cover, unlike previous versions. Yucky. Then, last week, he seams began unravelling, this is NOT the same quality pillow I purchased faux years ago for kid #1. Can't return it since the window is expired but will be trying to call customer supports or Leachco.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H

customer_reviews.title: Amazing item, love it so much. So many different functions
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing item that I can't live without. I have both types of the boppy pillow and while I do like them, they are just not as good as this. I love that I can strap my son in or not. He loves being able to sit on the bed with myself his brother and my fiance. I feel like he is so safe in this. I'm so glad that I decided to buy this. It's great for feeding, breast or bottle, hanging out, sleeping but only if your awake and watching baby, trasporting baby from one place to another without disturbing sleep. I think it's a must have item.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Simpson

customer_reviews.title: This is a great deal! This pillow can be used for so ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal! This pillow can be used for so many things, too! The only downside is that it doesn't have a cover on it, and I'm pretty sure you're not supposed to wash it. That is a little ridiculous for a baby product, considering babies are messy and have stuff coming out of both ends. I bought a Boppy cover from Target to see if it would work, and it did (although it's very snug), so I use the pillow with that cover on it. Overall this pillow is a great deal because it's so much cheaper than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: rapunzel711

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: We got a hand-me-down Leachco Cuddle-U from my SIL and loved it. It had a removable cover (washable! all baby stuff should be WASHABLE!) and was just the right thickness. When my daughter started daycare, we decided to buy another so we could leave one at home and one at daycare (instead of carrying germs back & forth every day). So naturally we went for another Leachco. Boo. This one does NOT have a removable cover and is so overstuffed/thick that we couldn't really use it for anything. I'll pass this along to someone else, but I feel a little guilty doing so, because this thing is really sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: MochaOnyx

customer_reviews.title: Love love LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: I've tried almost every nursing pillow there is and this is by far my favorite. It has just the perfect amount of filling. .. Not too much and not too little. Also I love how it fastens so my baby can sit in it and not slide. The velcro on it is like super velcro.. it's not coming off. And my favorite part is the price. For this type of quality I would pay more. I strongly recommend buying this over any other nursing pillow any day
customer_reviews.author: Bree Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my newborn but not comfortable for nursing
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is a must-have for newborns. I've been using it since day 1 and have really come to appreciate its versatility. I've found that covering the pillow up with a blanket before placing baby in it to lounge is more comfortable and supportive for him rather than leaving the space in-between the pillow and the flat surface it's sitting on. I will say that I have tried using it to breastfeed but it just wasn't comfortable for me or the baby. But to use it solely for the baby to lounge on makes it totally worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Jenilyn W.

customer_reviews.title: Its not of much use for newborns & infants even ...
customer_reviews.text: Its not of much use for newborns & infants even though the company advertise so..We found the pillow to be too thick, so could not use it for breastfeeding as the baby seems to be too elevated due to thickness of the pillow.. For the same reason we could not also give tummy time to the baby using this pillow as baby will literally hang or float over the pillow instead of just laying over it.. Considering the thickness you can use the pillow only when your baby grow pass 4 months or you have really long baby..
customer_reviews.author: Anarveka

customer_reviews.title: great help for me and my baby
customer_reviews.text: This really helped me keep my posture while breastfeeding. My baby loves sleeping on this while I have him on my lap, it's that soft and comfortable for him. My only complaint is that two months after we started using it, the filling started pushing through the cover. I keep finding bits of it on my baby's face and it's becoming annoying. I haven't washed this, only spot cleaned the areas that need it. I always use a swaddle blanket to protect it from spit ups and drool but it would have been nicer if it had a cover in the first place. Still, we use this everyday so I'm giving it a 4.
customer_reviews.author: Lanessa

customer_reviews.title: Not enough height for me and baby
customer_reviews.text: I had no luck with nursing pillows all around. I nursed and continue to nurse my 10 month old the old school way - with my arms. All nursing pillows in my opinion are not high enough and not sturdy enough. I felt like I was still having to use my arms anyways with this pillow. Unfortunately I sent mine back. If other moms are getting good use out of this then that's great but it was not for me!
customer_reviews.author: Anne W.

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to My Brest Friend nursing Pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow was helpful at first ( 2 months ) but then it just became annoying. It flattened out and it pushes away when your baby is on it. My LO always sunk into the pillow so her back would always be bent so I always had to prop her up with more pillow or hold her up which became difficult after a while. Also, there is not removeable cover, so I had to wash the whole thing which wasn't bad, it actually fluffed up again. I'm going to keep it for her to use when she wants to play. I went ahead and bought My Brest Friend friend nursing pillow instead.
customer_reviews.author: Starlet

customer_reviews.title: Great Pillow
customer_reviews.text: This was a less expensive version of the Boppy, yet it actually had an additional feature...the strap. The strap, which could be tucked away in the pocket when not in use, helped to keep the baby from sliding down when in an upright position. The pillow grew with the baby and was used for so many things: bottle feeding, tummy time, crawling on, and sitting upright. It is a nice size, firmly padded, and surface wipes clean. The pretty sage green color is gender neutral, although it isn't removable. I simply got into the habit of draping a small receiving blanket over the pillow to protect it from drools.
customer_reviews.author: PMC

customer_reviews.title: I found this to be better than the Boppy pillows for nursing
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be better than the Boppy pillows for nursing. It is thicker, so the baby will be raised up a bit higher. This is really nice if you've had a c-section. I also find this one to be better at support a larger/older baby because of the bigger size. I did not buy a separate cover; any spills wash out just fine by tossing it in the washer and dryer.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Leigh Durian

customer_reviews.title: Not a good pillow for nursing for small babies
customer_reviews.text: As a nursing pillow, this is no better/different than the standard bobby. All issues of the bobby apply: Does not stay in place on the lap, is too rounded and so the baby slides, etc. We purchased the "My Breast Friend" after using this for a week on the new born and what a difference. My Breast Friend is designed for 1 purpose: nursing the baby. In comparison, the Leachco tries to do many things and fails badly in comparison to My Breast Friend as a nursing pillow.
customer_reviews.author: InverseIQ

customer_reviews.title: It has helped great with support and comfort while breastfeeding
customer_reviews.text: It has helped great with support and comfort while breastfeeding.Many nights i snuggle him in the nook of my arm and his pillow and fall fast asleep while he feeds and dont have to worry about dropping him. My kid is now 9 months and still use his nursing pillow. I prop him up in the mornings with his bottle and put on his favorite cartoon while i get ready for work. It has even helped with his sleep, When he is having upset stomach i make him sleep elevated in his pillow. It is just very useful as a mother.
customer_reviews.author: MIMI

customer_reviews.title: Instead of Boppy newborn lounger....
customer_reviews.text: I logged on to purchase the newborn lounger but realized my baby would grow out of that fairly quickly. This pillow is a great value for the price! My 3 month old loves this we are using it quite a bit just to lounge in on my bed. My only complaint is that the strap part that my 6 year old.calls the "underwears part" is not stretchy so its a little stiff/tight on baby's chubby thighs, especially when they begin to slide down into it more. So you have to readjust him and check he is getting circulation to his legs periodically. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: patricia Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect nursing pillow
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Leachco pillow that we have purchased and we absolutely LOVE them. Our 2 year old still has the one that we bought for when in was nursing him, he loves it and won't share it with anyone except Dad when they snuggle on the couch. Our newborn fits perfectly on the new one. I'm sure he will love his pillow just as much as our oldest when he gets bigger. These pillows are the perfect height to keep baby close during nursing without me having to slouch over to nurse him. Once they get a little bigger this pillow is perfect for tummy time and to prop them up when sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi R

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, you need this for baby
customer_reviews.text: This is more versatile than the name brand folks talk about. The crotch snap is the bomb. We've used it for all kinds of propping with the baby--sitting, tummy time, etc. Our little guy has such fat thighs that the well marketed plastic seat didn't work for him (he could not wedge in there at 3 months even) and this was a bit of a substitute for that, supervised of course. Never did use it much for nursing, as the good Lord saw fit to leave me with my own built in pillow post childbirth, but you can't fault the product for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the pillows
customer_reviews.text: I like the pillows, i liked them more the first kid vs second. I found the velcro/seat thing to be more annoying w my second and the inability to take the cover off to wash it, so i placed a different cover on that i can remove to wash. Otherwise, good nursing pillow
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion this pillow is better than the boppy
customer_reviews.text: In my opinion this pillow is better than the boppy. It is sturdy and supportive. Gives my aching arms a break and my daughter is comfortable. Will also fit the boppy cover though it is a snug fit. I did not give all five stars only because I do see some fibers coming out of the pillow (show in first pic) and if I didn't have a cover for it, I would worry about the baby getting these in her mouth. Also, when you do cover it, you don't get to use the strap in function which is a really awesome bonus feature on this pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Sixinthemix

customer_reviews.title: A must for breastfeeding moms
customer_reviews.text: 8 months later and I'm still using this pillow. Great for breastfeeding, perfect for tummy time, strap baby in before they're able to crawl or rollover. Pocket to tuck straps away. Only thing I don't like is that the cover isn't removable.
customer_reviews.author: Bruklyn

customer_reviews.title: Had great potential, but fell short.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great idea, but it could be so much better. For one thing, the cover doesn't come off so to wash it you have to throw the whole pillow in the wash - which is just stupid. It also ripped at the seam after only a week and stuffing pokes out. I stitched it up, but again, a hassle. If I had to do it again I would just go with a regular nursing pillow (with a removable cover!) and if you're feeling crafty, add the velcro and straps. I gave it three stars because for all of its flaws, I still get a good bit of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: KStrickland

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We use this every day for nursing. The seatbelt portion is great to keep baby from wiggling down. I actually use this as a pillow to take naps in the family room when the baby takes his naps. Its very fluffy and hasn't lost any shape. I also have a boppy that I keep in the nursery and the leachco that I keep in the family room seems to be less bulky and obtrusive. I also have the whole family hooked on using it to support their arms when they hold the baby. Only thing is we bought a replacement cover as you cant take off the Sage Pin dot cover to wash it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy construction. Developed a hole after three days of use.
customer_reviews.text: I got this to breastfeed my baby. After using it for about three days--my baby is now one week old, the seam burst at one of the ends of the pillow and fluff started leaking out. Now it's basically just taking up space on my couch. I purchased another brand (my Brest friend pillow) and am much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Lacy

customer_reviews.title: Mom’s best friend!
customer_reviews.text: Great pillow! No need to buy something crazy expensive. This pillow is comfortable for both my baby and myself.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene Carrillo

customer_reviews.title: Great nurser...Great price...Great quality!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great pillow. I like this better than the boppy. Its a little bigger. I love the strap, helps so baby doesn't slip down and more secure as well. I also love how I can just throw it in the washer and it dries very quick. My daughter loves it. I use it for feeding, tummy time and just sitting with the straps. Wish there was more material options but not a big deal. Best of all you can't beat the price. So glad I got this over the boppy.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Ducosin

customer_reviews.title: Nice recline option even for co sleeping moms
customer_reviews.text: My baby loves this! He sleeps in it most nights, and it fits into our sidecar co sleeper (the Arms Reach full size) if I want a little more room in bed. I am glad it has the support strap even though it looks a little silly. I tried it one night without it and he slid down too far. This is great for babies who like to be reclined vs lying flat, and this position is actually more beneficial to young ones' spinal development. It's also a great nursing pillow, more comfortable than the Brest Friend which I had been using before.
customer_reviews.author: ShamanMcDoula

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Was perfect, my daughter used this pillow for support until she could set on her own. Was easy to clean and never lost shape
customer_reviews.author: keshia

customer_reviews.title: I'm really annoyed with the little tiny curly threads of stuffing peeking ...
customer_reviews.text: While I haven't had the issues other people have had with the stitching coming apart at the seams, I'm really annoyed with the little tiny curly threads of stuffing peeking out through the fabric itself. It makes the pillow itchy and uncomfortable and the only reason I'm keeping the pillow is because I don't want to go through the hassle of returning it. Note that I said it's coming through the fabric, not the seams! I've even found some of the tiny plastic stuffing threads on my newborn's face!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Watanabe

customer_reviews.title: I tried to put it around myself like it is supposed to go I ended up readjusting ...
customer_reviews.text: Beware if you have large breasts , it is do high it didn't work for us !This pillow was promising I wanted to work so badly especially because I had a hard time nursing but the pillow is too big and comes up too high , I tried to put it around myself like it is supposed to go I ended up readjusting it every minute because it would slide away from my body leaving an empty space between me and pillow where my son would sink in. So after several attempts I just gave up and gave it to a friend . i wish I had spent a little more and got a different brand!
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: For mum feeding
customer_reviews.text: We used it for feeding. It is soft and good, but not fit well with me -- maybe just me because I am thin.
customer_reviews.author: Ping

customer_reviews.title: I love this pillow
customer_reviews.text: I love this pillow. I use it pretty much every time I feed my daughter. She also loves sitting in it and playing or watching her brother run around. I have gotten so much use out of it, I definitely recommend it. Some other nursing pillows I've seen are so squishy and get flat, this one keeps its shape and is firm enough to be suportive while still comfortable. I've washed it several times with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica DeLauder

customer_reviews.title: Great boppy alternative
customer_reviews.text: This is a great alternative to the boppy. We have a boppy I bought used with two covers. It did the trick, but this pillow is wonderful. Way more stuffing then the boppy plus the added bonus of the harness thatd secured by velcro, which folds up into a little pocket only down side is the cover isn't washable or removable. The seams and stitching on mine seem strong.
customer_reviews.author: BoyMom2

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these after my daughter was born to replace the My Brest Friend (which was terrible). I love it and so does my baby. We are still using it 9 months later. So when my sister in law had her baby shower I knew she had to have one. The Velcro safety strap is a great bonus. Except this one doesn't have a removable cover for washing and the one I purchased for myself did, so I left out a star for that.
customer_reviews.author: L. Long

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow, it just doesn't last very well
customer_reviews.text: Great pillow, it just doesn't last very well. For the price I guess it's good. Great for nursing as well as helping baby to practice tummy time and sitting up. I have had the pillow almost 3 months and I have not washed it yet but it has broken and developed two relatively large holes.
customer_reviews.author: JLJ

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this pillow
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this pillow! I bought it for My baby since she doesn't seem to like laying flat and she sleeps on it all the time. I love that this has a harness, so I don't have to worry about my baby slipping down or rolling over or both. I don't know what I'd do without this. I'll be getting this for every baby shower in the future
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Better than a boppy for infants
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is wonderful! My 2 month old baby boy has some reflux so I try to keep him elevated. I have a boppy pillow as well but he'd always slide down in it. The Leachco pillow is SO much better for positioning and comfort for when he's lounging or sleeping. The only downfall is that the cover is not removable but you can buy additional slip covers specifically for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: I order this for my daughter as a baby shower gift ,and let me tell you this is a must have for any mother that is expecting.This pillow has so many uses,and my grand-son loves it.
customer_reviews.author: PRINCESS

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow! :)
customer_reviews.text: Very nice pillow!!! Very cushiony and love the pink color. I like how the straps can be tucked away when not needed. Some complained of not being able to wash cover, but I have another boppy pillow with a removable cover and it's the same thing, I keep a blanket on them so that they don't get dirty. I also like that this one has more padding, so that it holds baby better when in a sitting position. My other pillow is saggy and my baby tilts to the sides. I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia F.

customer_reviews.title: Got tons of use
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is so versatile. I used it for nursing, tummy time, and as a pillow for my baby to lean on so she could watch things around her as we worked or played with her. The seat wrap really does help keep your baby from sliding down and when she got older and could sit up I used it as a cushion around her in case she fell over. Overall this got great use out of it for months and was worth purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: SUSU&LILI

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pillow ..its a must buy
customer_reviews.text: The pillow is huge...it is extremly comfortable and it's just right...not too soft and not too hhard....it mimics the comfort of a mother's womb..my newborn sleeps for hours on it ...she prefers it over her basinet...i wish I had one when I had my son
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Alternative to Boppy
customer_reviews.text: This product is a fantastic alternative to the infamous Boppy pillow. The strap is great for new babies, and it is just as functional as its competitor. My only concern is that there do not seem to be any cover change options. That being said, it is possible that a Boppy cover would fit. The pillow seems to be the same size, but I've yet to find out. Regardless, there are still a few color choices when purchasing and the cover is easily removed for washing.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Gift
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift and they loved it. They used it often and now that baby is too big, the toddler uses it as a tv chair sort of like a bean bag. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for my twins before they were born, who are now 11 months old. I was looking at their pictures today of when they were a month old and in every picture the Leachco was utilized in some form. It really saved us when I think back to how many times we used them and I can’t thank you enough for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jo6hanna

customer_reviews.title: Really Love This Pillow!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son because he was sleeping in his car seat most of the time due to spitting up issues and sinus problems. I didn't want him to sleep flat because I was afraid he would choke when he spit up. We got this pillow and it has been a great relief...to me, the baby and my husband. He very seldom spits up and his sinuses are usually clear when he sleeps on this pillow. The only downside that I can find, and the only reason I didn't give it 5 starts is because you can't buy a cover for it. I just throw a blanket or towel over it and it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Good harness but loud velcro :)
customer_reviews.text: This was a good nursing pillow that supported baby and I through the different arm positions you end up adopting for nursing as baby grows. The upsides: *The harness was great for keeping baby in position when he started rolling over. *The whole thing washes really well and keeps its shape and firmness. The downsides: *The velcro was SO loud that if baby fell asleep in the harness, undoing the velcro woke him up almost every time! *The cover is not removable. However, I did pick up an extra bobby cover on sale that fit like a glove, which was great as baby got older and couldn't fit the harness anyway. Overall I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Miss B.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: I gave it four stars because you can’t take the cover off, the entire thing has to go in the washer
customer_reviews.author: Ckip

customer_reviews.title: It was a good tummy time experience for my daughter she used to ...
customer_reviews.text: It was a good tummy time experience for my daughter she used to see herself in the mirror while late in to the rhymes. You can wash it in the washer as it was passed down to my niece who had acid reflux so lots of milk but it got washed
customer_reviews.author: Thomas play mat

customer_reviews.title: It's HUGE
customer_reviews.text: I actually liked this when I was nursing. It was support for him to just fall asleep on it as well, but it was hard to maneuver around it. It's pretty big. It took up all the space in my rocker and my lap. The strap is kind of annoying because it falls out really easily and is this giant string of fabric when you're not using it. I never used the strap because he was kind of always wedged into it. Now that he is 7 months he rarely uses it anymore, but my Puggle loves laying in it now for his naps.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ross

customer_reviews.title: In comparison to the Boppy brand this is much better! I found it to fit around me better
customer_reviews.text: In comparison to the Boppy brand this is much better! I found it to fit around me better. I also loved that I could use it as a seat and harness him in which the Boppy does not do. This one does not have a removal cover but I still washed it on the genital cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Lagos

customer_reviews.title: Looove it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it she will sit in it forever.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: This works great!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as gifts, but kept one at home for visits. I like that the strap holds the baby from sliding off and that it grips very well. We had an accident on it but it cleaned easy. The down side is the cover does not come off so you have to spot clean. I'm not sure if they sell covers for them or not. I have not looked. I'm happy with it though. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M.

customer_reviews.title: I want an adult one!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is a comfy place for the baby to sit while also being a comfortable nursing pillow. I actually didn't use it very long for a nursing pillow because we had some latch issues that required unique positioning but the time that I did use it for that was great. My favorite part is the strap that hold the baby. This is a feature you won't on other nursing pillows. I've used two others and this is my favorite. And you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Atwood

customer_reviews.title: Good for baby
customer_reviews.text: I really don't use this is a nursing pillow. I use it to prop up my baby. Right now she is 2 months so it's great to lay her in it to watch me cook or do chores. Later she can use it for tummy time and when she can sit up. There are so many ways to use this pillow. It's bigger than a boppy pillow too. So if you want to breastfeed I recommend a smaller pillow this one was too bulky to use for nursing. Too hard but a good hard for baby when they want to lay or sit in it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: perfect fit for us!
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is awesome! My breastfriend pillow sucks. This one is awesome for babies with acid reflux and then a feeding pillow when baby is older. We still use it for breastfeeding and I love it. I can actually sit back and relax when feeding my baby. Also I got mine for $19.99 because I got a different color. Its a bit lame that a color/print changes the price. I will be gifting one to my friend. Love this pillow!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size (not too big and not too small) and very "fluffy" and comfy! My daughter LOVED it for many months (until she grew o
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size (not too big and not too small) and very "fluffy" and comfy! My daughter LOVED it for many months (until she grew out of it)! Best price here at Amazon for something like this. Similar ones (diff brand) cost MUCH more, and they are not any better! It so so comfy, she wound up falling asleep in it, while she was bottle fed!
customer_reviews.author: ALS

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The Cuddle U is so comfy that my baby loves to sleep with it and uses it also for sitting support
customer_reviews.author: boycharlie57

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Love this. It was better than the boppy. I had one when I had my son and used it till it fell apart. 9 years later my daughter surprised us and Hubby ordered this for me. It is made well and works great. I put her on her tummy on it and she likes it until she is tired of tummy time. Great for when I sit her in it (like the picture) and we can play and talk to each other. My son love to use it while he feeds his little sis. =O)
customer_reviews.author: Mrsbean2u

customer_reviews.title: stuffing is comming out after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is great for letting baby sit prompt up for pictures, but it is not firm enough to use to nurse. I used a boppy nursing pillow before this one and would say it is better. Even better than the boppy (for nursing) is one called my breast friend nursing pillow. I can't believe I nursed my other kids without it. I love that the back pilow relieves stress on your back and that the pillow stays in the correct position.
customer_reviews.author: Steph

customer_reviews.title: Cuddle-U vs Boppy
customer_reviews.text: I needed a Boppy and came across the Cuddle-U and I have to say i have had both and the Cuddle-U is so much better, safer, softer and cheaper too....I love the belt it hold my son in place and he is a kicker and when you no longer need the belt it folds and store neatly in a small pouch underneath the pillow. The only difference between these two products is that the Boppy is made of a more durable material. But I wouldn't change my Cuddle-U I love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Janetp729

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Kind of big if you’re wanting it to sit newborns in. It does its job though. I’m sure it’ll be more handy the older my son gets!
customer_reviews.author: Teraneka

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: The function of the pillow works as expected. However, Ive only used this pillow for 12 weeks and the stitching has already started to come undone causing the stuffing is falling out. Pretty disappointed with the quality of this pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Roxygidget

customer_reviews.title: This is the pillow!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the things I couldn't live without as a new first time mom. We ended up ordering one for upstairs and one for downstairs. I use it everytime I nurse and the baby likes to sit on it as well as be propped up on it for tummy time. It is such a great price and the pillow is great quality. DEFINITELY order this one if you are choosing a nursing pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Listen to this

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I used it for nursing my son, and then I used it for his tummy time and as seating for him. He is 9 months old and he still uses it. He likes to nap in it, so I lay down on the floor next to him and use my computer or watch tv as he sleeps. It says spot clean, but I put it in the wash and dryer on low and it comes out fine. Great quality. It'll be in good condition to use for the next baby.
customer_reviews.author: Angelbabe531

customer_reviews.title: Great use
customer_reviews.text: Its been two years since i bought this product and i think i am ready to review it. I bought this for my little girl. I used it for her feedings, to keep her in one spot, for tummy time, helped her to sit in there. I found many uses of this pillow and i would recommend to any mother. It wouldnt be wrong. The only reason i gave it a 4 star is because i cannot take out the cover to wash. You will have to be a little careful there. Otherwise..great product, great value, great use. Enjoy
customer_reviews.author: S. Maheta

customer_reviews.title: So-so
customer_reviews.text: I can definitely tell a difference between this and the boppy. The boppy is firmer and something I wish I had instead. This does the job during nursing but isn't as firm; a boppy is just made better. This doesn't come with a removable cover so you have to buy one. For $10-15 more I'm pretty sure you can get a boppy that comes with a removable cover, making it cheaper in the end.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Very upset...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and it did not even come with the cover.... they sent me one for free, and the cover didn't even fit!! I finally get it on, and it rips within the day.... should've gone with Bobby... I emailed Leachco voicing my issues and did not ever hear a response from them. I'm very upset and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: love this pillow
customer_reviews.text: love this pillow. delivery was fast (though i have to say, the box it came it was a bit of an overkill). product is highly recommended especially when you have a baby who loves to kick - won't slip down anymore. cheaper than a boppy and i think more comfortable. had a boppy pillow with my first and i remember it to be expensive and uncomfortable.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMarya

customer_reviews.title: Soooo much better than a boppy
customer_reviews.text: Soooo much better than a boppy! The strap keeps my squirmy baby in the cushion. My mom has a boppy for when she babysits and my baby slides right out or ends up in a bad position. Baby straight chills in this safely. This fits boppy covers of you decide to cover it. The strap rolls up and folds into a built in pocket if you decide not to use it. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: Truestory

customer_reviews.title: I was a little disappointed with how long it took to receive it
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed with how long it took to receive it...thought maybe they had to hand sew it per order ;-p not as full as other pillows I have bought. pricier than other pillows. I would recommend checking out less expensive distributors of these types of pillows. I do like that the cover is removable and can be washed..Some do not by this manufacturer.. plus side
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Markham

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing! It washed great and I like that he can be strapped in, especially since he's so wiggly. He also gets strapped in for tummy time and he loves it more than on a flat surface, or not being strapped in.
customer_reviews.author: Mespinosa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - so glad I got this
customer_reviews.text: I use it more for baby to lay on, she loves it - I'm so happy I got this and use it constantly . I'm bottle feeding so I'm not sure how good it is for nursing, but it's great for baby to lay on and look around, she does tummy time on ot too, and the seatbelt strap is great, keeps her from slipping - she's a squirm worm and only 6 weeks. She's laying on it right now as I type! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Works well for preemies
customer_reviews.text: This product worked extremely well for our preemie son. Due to his apnea and Brady episodes, we needed something he could lay in that would keep him propped up enough to keep his airway completely open. This was a Godsend for our family!
customer_reviews.author: Kali

customer_reviews.title: Great for airplane trips with infants
customer_reviews.text: This pillow is great for airplane trips with infants. I was tired of bringing pillows to prop up my arms for holding and nursing my baby. This was just what I needed. It was comfortable and baby slept in my arms on this pillow for the whole red eye flight with no issues. I was so nervous about the red eye flight with a 7 month old but this save dam y life, seriously! I bought the organic Boppy slipcover for it as it doesn't come with one and it fit great and is super soft.
customer_reviews.author: M. Buist

customer_reviews.title: great pillow!!
customer_reviews.text: I think this pillow is better then the boppy because it has the strap. My little ones always slide off the boppy and I was constantly going over to fix them. With this strap they can stay in place and you don't have to worry. I also like that if you don't want to use the strap you can just fold it up and put it in the little pocket.
customer_reviews.author: AGentz

customer_reviews.title: Cannot remove cover
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had caught in the description that the outer cover is not removable for washing..... 😑 My baby comes in a week so I'll be keeping it and buy a spare cover. Boo
customer_reviews.author: lbm

customer_reviews.title: As Good As the Boppy
customer_reviews.text: I got this to help my daughter learn to sit up, so when she toppled she wouldn't crash on the floor. But I also ended up using it to nurse her even though she's 6 months old. It's very comfortable and I think softer than the Boppy so it's easier to smush into place. It also makes a nice comfy pillow for me when reading in bed! Good buy over all.
customer_reviews.author: Elfbrick

customer_reviews.title: Great! Just as good as more well known pillows!
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good as more expensive pillows! I love that it has the ability to strap your little one in while on the floor or where ever. The only negative thing I can say is when you have the strap tucked in the pocket, it eventually falls out if you are lifting it up etc. It would be nice if there was some way to secure that strap while not in use other than just tucking in the pocket. Great value for the $$!
customer_reviews.author: Mary R.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's great, I use it all the time to feed my newborn. It helps with my tired arms :)
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Curry

customer_reviews.title: I tried most of nursing pillows, but this is THE BEST!
customer_reviews.text: I tried most of nursing pillows, but this is THE BEST! I used this for nursing and my baby to have a nap. Great shape, size and safe! Especially when my son had a said reflex, this helped him to sleep better. I used everyday until a baby start rolling around.
customer_reviews.author: be a healthy puppy

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I boughts two of these for my twins when they were much younger. They were slipping under the Boppy pillows and that scared me. These held them in great. The velcro is very sturdy and won't come undone. The straps do get tangled in the washer sometimes, and I actually had to cut one of mine out of the washer :(
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Peters

customer_reviews.title: This boppy is so much more affordable than the boppy ...
customer_reviews.text: This boppy is so much more affordable than the boppy, and I actually much prefer the size of this one. It is slightly bigger and softer than the boppy brand.
customer_reviews.author: Justine Cheema

customer_reviews.title: Just okay for me
customer_reviews.text: I tried using this for a nursing pillow, but I much prefer the "Breast Friend" pillow for nursing. I am going to keep this pillow in the car for on-the-go and will likely still use it so baby can lounge in the living area while I am puttering around the house. Still a good value, just not my preference when it comes to a nursing pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Audoliste

customer_reviews.title: A new baby must have!
customer_reviews.text: I have used for my son since birth. They can sleep in it or use it to sit up. Also a nursing pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Bradleychef88

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels nice
customer_reviews.text: Havent put this to use yet as my baby will not be born for another couple of weeks...However, I can say that its nice and cushy but still firm. I love the idea of the little strap to keep them from sliding down and cant wait to use it. We got the sage/polka dot. Good price and good product so far! If my opinion changes after using it, I will update, but I don't see that happening.
customer_reviews.author: DessaJaily

customer_reviews.title: Came as expected
customer_reviews.text: The only thing is I thought the cover would come off so I could wash it it does not come off.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Pillow Covering Doesn't Come Off
customer_reviews.text: This is a good pillow and works very well BUT I was disappointed that I did not realize the pillow does not have a removable cover before I purchased it. The manufacturer recommends only spot cleaning the pillow; they caution against washing the pillow itself in case the filling lumps. Spot cleaning just doesn't cut it for me, personally.
customer_reviews.author: L. Mac

customer_reviews.title: It's still her favorite seat of the house
customer_reviews.text: It served its purpose and more. Now she is almost one year. She still loves to play with it every day. It's still her favorite seat of the house. I use it as a pillow sometime too. It never lose it shape, still soft and fluffy. Love it for quality and price.
customer_reviews.author: Mycorollababy

customer_reviews.title: Great pillow
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is very happy with this pillow, baby spends lots of time just hanging out in the sitting position in it too in the middle of the bed playing with toys. It has a nice amount of stuffing and has held up well. When baby was small she could not have been with out one, really helps with nursing!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Griz

product_meta.title: Leachco Cuddle-U Basic Nursing Pillow and More, Sage Pin Dot
product_meta.description: Color:Sage Pin DotCuddle-U Basic Nursing Pillow and More is a multipurpose pillow with various functions and uses. As a nursing pillow, the U-shaped design can help ease muscle strain and allow for easier feeding times for both parent and baby. The patented safety wrap helps wigglers stay in place while in a reclined position. Proper reclined positioning encourages digestion and may also help to reduce reflux. As your little one grows, the Cuddle-U Basic also can be used for tummy time and sit-up support. A concealed pocket is attached to the underneath side of the pillow, so when it's time for feeding, tummy time, or sitting up just fold and tuck away the seat wrap. The Cuddle-U Basic does not include a removable cover.
feature_bullets: When used as a lounger, use the seat wrap to help keep reclined babies in place
As a nursing pillow, the U-shaped design can help support for comfy feedings
When little ones grow big enough, use for tummy time and sit-up support
Tuck seat wrap into pocket when used for feeding, tummy time, or sitting up
Cover is not removable on Cuddle-U Basic

specifications.Safety warning: Warning: Keep this bag away from babies and children. Do not use in cribs, beds, carriages or playpens. The thin film may cling to nose and mouth and prevent breathing.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars1,080 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
